comment._content:

comment.author: 94563365@N00
comment._content: what's the story on this-1914 --result of war?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Seems likely. WWI broke out in Europe two days earlier. 
Evidently the German-American Bank survived this run on its funds. The bank had been founded in 1870, and thought it wise to change its name in 1918, after Germany lost the war and all things German were held in low esteem hereabouts.
Through a succession of mergers, it eventually became a part of Chemical Bank, now Chase.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Wystan--Thank you for the related images, date and context for these images  of the German American bank.  We will update the descriptions.
